reviews.review: 남녀노소 함께 즐길 수 있는 즐거운 캐주얼 게임

오버쿡2 예약구매하고 발매일만 기다리며 리뷰 작성합니다

말 필요없음 개꿀잼

그런데 처음에 할 때 불편한게 이 게임을 하기 위해서 게임패드를 구매해야 했습니다...
사실 저의 어리석음 때문이죠
키보드 하나로 당연히 4명이서 못할텐데....하하하... 생각 안하고 게임부터 구매해가지고...ㅠㅠ
그래서 패드 두개 사서 반쪽씩 나눠썼습니다
생각보다 괜찮습니다 배분을 잘 해놓은 것 같아요

그런데 사공이 많으면 배가 산으로 간다고 이상하게 4명일 때보다 2명이서 하는게 더 쉬웠습니다
물론 2명이서 할 때는 사람이 더 있으면 좋겠다는 생각도 들어요
설거지 노예를 원하게 됩니다ㅎㅎㅎ
그래도 2명이서 올3스타로 dlc까지 깰 수 있습니다

난이도도 적당한 편입니다
그런데 발판 타고 물 건너는 맵의 난이도는 극악이에요
캐릭터가 대쉬를 쓰면서 다른 캐릭터에게 부딪히면 밀칠 수가 있는데...ㅋ... 예상이 가시겠죠
물에 몇번이나 빠졌는지 모르겠습니다
형제랑 둘이서 하는데 멱살 잡고 난리도 아니었습니다
캐릭터가 옹알옹알 말하는 버튼도 있는데 분명 그건 욕일겁니다 100%

혀튼 강추합니다

dlc도 재미있어요 그런데 dlc는 스테이지가 적어서 아쉽습니다
대신 크리스마스 맵을 무료로 추가해줘서 괜찮아요 
새로운 레시피가 나오기 때문에 강추합니다 부리또 만들기 재밌어욤
크리스마스 맵은 칠면조 요리를 할 수 있습니다
칠면조 요리는 화염방사기 써서 재밌습니다
둘 다 꿀잼입니다

강추드려요 꼭 사세요

오버쿡2는 온라인 멀티플레이가 된다고 해서 더욱 기대하고 있습니다ㅎㅎㅎ
닌텐도 스위치에서도 구매 가능합니다 스위치가 예약구매 특전 캐릭터가 더 있더라구요
물론 전 그래도 스팀으로 구매했지만...ㅋㅋㅋ
So much fun! Have a good laugh with your friends as you play. Communication is key! (Just like a real life kitchen ha!)

This game is a blast to play with friends. I've played through the whole thing probably about 4 or 5 times with different people, and its always fun to play since the dynamic changes from team to team. The only gripe I have with it is that its local multiplayer only, but they seem to have added online multiplayer with Overcooked! 2. 

The humor is on point and the gameplay is 10/10. I'd definitely recommend this.

For me this is the best splitscreen / couch Co-op game to date! 
Unbeatable, 10/10
Frantic coop fun with friends and loved ones. This is a must as far as couch multiplayer goes imo, you will be shouting food and ingredients names as if you were Gordon Ramsay.
my girlfriend love it (right hand)
PERFECT

The only downside I see is that there is no online multiplayer.
I'd recommend buying it on sale, though- the story gets finished quite quickly.

Bought this game on sale without knowing anything about it going in

TL;DR - Great game, minor annoyance with level unlocks, good controls, good local co op support, reccommend at full price *Thumbs up*

it is awesome
its a party game where everyone has to rush to make food and serve it before time runs out, and you must get a certain amount of points to earn ratings on that level, its simple and great.

Simple controls - move, chop, pick/drop. 

My only gripe with the game is that in order to play every available level, you have to have a certain amount of overall stars from your "ratings" similar to Super Mario 64 sorta thing. However, this isnt the gripe, i dont have a problem with obtaining enough points, and being skilled enough to unlock levels. HOWEVER it is a bit of a problem, when the threshhold for unlocking levels is very high and you have to sorta grind, by playing levels over again to get 2 or 3 stars to be able to play 1 level. This wasnt a particular problem until mid-late game however, but the game does expect you to get 2 or 3 stars out of every level if you wanna play all the levels and beat the game.


That however is my only annoyance, a high star requirement (possible 3 stars for every level). Just playing some levels over and over to get an absurd amount of points to unlock a single extra star to play the next level and then do that sorta thing again, can be annoying, but fortunately not boring. Replaying levels again isnt so bad when you have to try harder and you get better at the game, sometimes its easier, but again, i feel i shouldnt have to get perfect ratings on so many levels.

That point aside, this is a great game, lots of fun and it has amazing local co op gameplay, you can even share a keyboard and one controller (one controller, 2 people, its nuts i know) between 2 people, me and my girlfriend have been playing on her laptop keyboard and its a little cramped, but not toO bad at all or hindering our  experience.

I paid $5 for everything, but i say full price is worth it too.

Great game.
controlling two characters is so hard. I cant even get three stars on first level ;(

This is the most addictive couch-potato games that I have ever played with my friends and colleagues. Simple and fun. There's a lot of unique kitchen layout through the stages.  The only cons that I would say is that it is very boring or very hard playing alone even though you could by shifting control over 2 characters. Some of the hard stages would need more than 2 people to get 3 syars as it need more cooperation and helper around.
one of the best couch co-op games I've played in a really really long time!
Fun game! Wasn't sure about it but gave it a shot. Challenging but enjoyable.
do you sell friend dlc?

[b]Score – 9/10 (Fantastic)[/b]
Overcooked! is a must-have for those looking for quality, family friendly, couch co-op titles: if you ever wanted to have a go at running a restaurant in ridiculous circumstances and exotic locations, this is the game for you. Just make sure you're playing it with co-operative older kids or adults, otherwise it will be a recipe for disaster (mind the pun).

https://www.choicestgames.com/2018/08/overcooked-review.html

Playing this game with friends is a blast. Wouldn't personally play it alone as for me the interactive aspect is quite valuable. Unfortunately there is no online multiplayer - look at overcooked! 2 if that's a dealbreaker for you

This game recently got a sequel, but the original is still worth playing, especially if you can get it on sale. It can feel very chaotic and stressful (like a real kitchen), but it's well worth standing the heat, especially if you have friends to co-op with. You can watch me and my friend fumble around the kitchen in Overcooked below. [url]https://youtu.be/j2Wqy-BNcaA[/url]
food.
We need a online version, so we can play with friends everywhere.
